Name: Lifesystems Pocket First Aid Kit, CE Certified Contents, Specifically Designed for Hiking and Outdoor
Reviews: Would recommend, perfect size. Belt clip has a Velcro and stud to ensure this stays secure.I’ve added additional plasters and paracetamol, Ibuprofen too, there’s even room for a chapstick. There’s is a little additional space for these items if you cut the tablet to size.A really handy piece of kit for the car, walking or travelling about. Handy to have around the home too.Well worth the price, love how everything packs in so well. Bought this over the more robust kits on Amazon as this stands up to BSE standards.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 June 2020

Name: Lifesystems Pocket First Aid Kit, CE Certified Contents, Specifically Designed for Hiking and Outdoor
Reviews: I bought this for a bug out bag and it has everything I would expect or need from a compact first aid kit.Components seem good quality and it fits inside the fixed side pocket of a Maxpedition Monsoon backpack perfectly although it is a tight fit - certainly no room for anything else in there.I chose this kit specifically for that pocket and although the stated size is just larger than the pocket dimensions it will squash down slightly to fit inside no problem.Very pleased with this and it was a good price too - just hope I never need to use it.....
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 October 2023

Name: Lifesystems Pocket First Aid Kit, CE Certified Contents, Specifically Designed for Hiking and Outdoor
Reviews: This is a reasonably well thought out first aid kit.Pros:Easy to carry size, with space to add your own gear in. I've added a small pill bottle (with pills containing ibuprofen, parcetamol, aspirin, anti indigestion, caffeine & antihistamine tablets), condoms, hangover sachets and waterproof plasters, with space for a couple of extra items if needed (may add an aluminium blanket & ear plugs)Cons:Would have been nice to have it waterproof, they've got the waterproof zip on it, surely it wouldn't take much of a change or cost to do so as it's such of a small item and Lifesystems do make large waterproof versions, it would be nice for them to extend this feature to the rest of their range.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 June 2020

Reviews: Nice and compact set for first aid essentials.

Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 June 2023

Name: Lifesystems Pocket First Aid Kit, CE Certified Contents, Specifically Designed for Hiking and Outdoor
Reviews: Good little kit to keep in my rucksack.Contains all the essentials.Even has a decent pair of scissors and tweezers. And includes antiseptic cream.It's lightweight, and doesn't take up much space.Happy with purchase.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 June 2023

Name: Lifesystems Pocket First Aid Kit, CE Certified Contents, Specifically Designed for Hiking and Outdoor
Reviews: It’s a must when out walking
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 August 2022

Name: Lifesystems Pocket First Aid Kit, CE Certified Contents, Specifically Designed for Hiking and Outdoor
Reviews: The blue tube (i.e. antiseptic cream) shown in the video is not inluded in the list, nor in the actual package. Antiseptic wipe is not going to work in the smae way as the cream if you have an open wound. And I can't return the item because the seal in the zip has to be broken to check the content. How tricky.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 August 2018

Name: Lifesystems Pocket First Aid Kit, CE Certified Contents, Specifically Designed for Hiking and Outdoor
Reviews: the pack is small and light, has everything you need for a day out. There is also a bit of room for a couple extra items to be thrown in, i.e. chapstick, hand gel and painkiller pills etc.however unlike the picture suggests, there is no antiseptic cream (15g) within the pack, and I also find the zipper to be very stiff & the pack should be designed for a better clamshell opening.
Data_of_Reviews: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 January 2023
